instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> was heating up when injecting voltage on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> now gone and diode reading on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is now correct, however no boot or USB activity, I tried 2 <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> just in case before finding out the voltages below. 

<CHIP>U7400</CHIP> pin 17 is 0V 
<CHIP>U1970</CHIP> pin 2 is 0V

I think that is my problem, but in this case maybe CPU is dead, please help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
threads.message: Do you get voltage at pins 12, 16, 6?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
threads.message: Sorry, I should have included that, yes all those 3 have the correct voltage, 5V, 3.3V and 1.8V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
threads.message:
Then you should have voltage at L7430.
Post diode mode there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
threads.message:
Replace again <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and check all surrounding resistors.
Be sure to get good solders.
Also change <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR> and R/<CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
threads.message: New <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR> <CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7425</RESISTOR> and same exact behavior.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
threads.message: Possibly broken trace, or bad solders.
